DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Definitive Treatment Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the kind of surgery performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The treatment plan for a disease or disorder that has been chosen as the best one for a patient after all other choices have been considered._Performed; carried out.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The treatment plan for a disease or disorder that has been chosen as the best one for a patient after all other choices have been considered.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The treatment plan for a disease or disorder that has been chosen as the best one for a patient after all other choices have been considered.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TARGET per request by T.Davidsen and approved for release by D.Barkauskas. mc 4/24/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal tumor, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults.  It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites.  It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus).  Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom.  It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of all or part of a limb or other appendage.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of all or part of a limb or other appendage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal tumor, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults.  It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites.  It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus).  Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom.  It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults. It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites. It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus). Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
